tuv.seg: Organ and body donation
Corp agus orgáin a bhronnadh
• Whole body donation for medical research
• Orgáin a bhronnadh • Bronnadh coirp iomlán le haghaidh taighde leighis
Organ donation takes healthy tissues and organs from one person so that they can be transplanted into another person, replacing organs that are not healthy
Tugtar idir 200 agus 250 duine slán in Éirinn gach bliain mar gheall ar bhronnadh orgáin agus trasphlandú
Organs which are suitable for transplant include the heart, kidneys, lungs, liver and pancreas
Má bhíonn tú i do dheontóir orgáin agus/nó fíocháin, beidh deis agat thuas le cúigear a bhfuil a gcuid orgáin ag teipeadh orthu a thabhairt slán
Most organs are only transplanted after the death of the donor
Bealaí furasta chun do mhianta a chur in iúl ná cárta deontóra orgáin a iompar nó an rogha bronnta orgáin ar chúl do cheadúnas tiomána a shíniú
You can become an organ donor by carrying a donor card or using the Organ Donor Ecard smartphone app, or having your wishes noted on your driving licence
Is féidir leat orgáin áirithe a bhronnadh fad is atá tú beo. Is féidir le deontóirí beo duán a bhronnadh
You should tell your family or next-of-kin that you wish to donate your organs after your death
Chun a bheith i do dheontóir beo, ní mór duit toiliú eolasach a thabhairt
Your family or next-of-kin can inform a doctor or another healthcare professional in a hospital if they are asked about your wishes regarding organ donation
Tá orgáin eile nach féidir a bhronnadh ach amháin tar éis don duine bás a fháil (is iad sin, na duáin, an croí, na scamhóga, an paincréas, na súile, srl.)
Having a medical condition does not prevent you from becoming a donor (an individual decision will be made by a healthcare professional at the time of your death)
Ní chuireann riocht leighis cosc ort ó bheith i do dheontóir (déanfaidh gairmí cúram sláinte cinneadh aonair nuair a fhaigheann tú bás)
The medical team treating you if you are ill is separate from the transplant team
Tá an fhoireann leighis a chuireann cóireáil ort agus tú tinn scartha amach ón bhfoireann trasphlandaithe
Organs are only removed when 2 doctors, working independently, have certified that the person is dead following a series of strict tests

Ní bhaintear orgáin amach ach amháin nuair atá beirt dhochtúir, ag obair go neamhspleách ar a chéile, tar éis a dhearbhú go bhfuil an duine marbh tar éis sraith tástálacha déine a bheith déanta air/uirthi
It is important to know that the removal of organs is carried out with the same care and respect as any other operation
Tá sé tábhachtach fios a bheith agat go léirítear an cúram agus an meas céanna nuair a bhíonn orgáin á mbaint agus a bhíonn in aon obráid eile
Organ donation does not disfigure the body or change the way it looks nor does it cause any delay to funeral arrangements
Ní chuireann bronnadh orgáin an corp ó dhealramh ná ní athraíonn sé an chaoi a mbreathnaíonn an corp ná ní chuireann sé aon mhoill ar shocruithe sochraide
Organ donors and consent
Deontóirí orgáin agus toiliú
You can indicate your wishes by carrying an organ donor card or signing the organ donation option on the back of your driving licence
Is féidir leat do mhianta a chur in iúl trí chárta deontóra orgáin a iompar nó tríd an rogha deonaithe orgáin ar chúl do cheadúnas tiomána a shíniú
Organ donor cards are available from the Irish Donor Network (see below), through the Irish Kidney Association, and in doctors' surgeries and pharmacies
Tá cártaí deontóra orgáin ar fáil ó Líonra Deontóirí na hÉireann (Irish Donor Network) (féach thíos), trí Chumann Duán na hÉireann, agus i lialanna agus i gcógaslanna
Signing an organ donor card or a driving licence donation option indicates your willingness to have your organs used for transplant
Léiríonn síniú cárta deontóra orgáin nó rogha deontóra ar cheadúnas tiomána go bhfuil tú sásta go n-úsáidfí d’orgáin i gcomhair trasphlandaithe
It does not necessarily mean that they will be used
Ní chiallaíonn sé go mbainfear úsáid astu
There are various medical criteria and other conditions that must be met
Tá critéir mhíochaine agus coinníollacha eile nach mór a chomhlíonadh
To ensure safe transplantation, the death must take place in a hospital
Chun trasphlandú sábháilte a chinntiú, ní mór gur in ospidéal a bhásaigh an duine
Your next-of-kin should know of your wish to be an organ donor, but they are not bound to abide by your wishes and their consent is always required
Ba chóir go mbeadh a fhios ag dod’ neasghaol go bhfuil fonn ort a bheith i do dheontóir orgáin, ach níl siad faoi cheangal cloí le do mhianta agus bíonn gá lena dtoiliú i gcónaí
In all cases, the medical team requests the next-of-kin to donate the organs of a deceased person
I ngach cás, iarrann an fhoireann mhíochaine ar an neasghaol orgáin an té atá básaithe a bhronnadh
In practice, the consent of the next-of-kin is accepted as valid and a refusal by the next-of-kin is not contested
Go praiticiúil, glactar le toiliú an neasghaoil agus ní chuirtear i gcoinne an neasghaoil má dhiúltaíonn sé/sí orgáin a bhronnadh
Postmortems and organ donation
Scrúduithe Iarbháis agus orgáin a bhronnadh
In situations where a death is reported to the Coroner, permission must be obtained from the Coroner before organ donation can take place, as well as the written consent of the next-of-kin
I gcásanna ina dtuairiscítear bás don Chróinéir, ní mór cead a fháil ón gCróinéir sular féidir orgáin a bhronnadh, chomh maith le cead scríofa ón neasghaol
Where the Coroner grants permission for organ donation, any subsequent postmortem examination will be a limited one
Sa chás go dtugann an Cróinéir cead orgáin a bhronnadh, is scrúdú teoranta a bheidh in aon scrúdú iarbháis a dhéantar ina dhiaidh sin
Decisions about this matter are made by the Coroner in consultation with the Gardaí and medical professionals
Déanann an Cróinéir cinntí faoin ábhar seo i gcomhairle leis na Gardaí agus gairmithe leighis
In general, Coroners do facilitate requests for organ donation
Go ginearálta, éascaíonn Cróinéirí iarratais ar bhronnadh orgáin
Read more about the role of the Coroner and postmortems here
Léigh tuilleadh anseo faoi ról an Chróinéara agus Scrúduithe iarbháis
Organ donation for transplantation is not a postmortem practice and it is conducted in an operating theatre
Ní cleachtas iarbháis atá i mbronnadh orgáin i gcomhair trasphlandaithe, agus déantar in obrádlann é
Consent for the retention of organs for research is a postmortem practice conducted in a mortuary
Is cleachtas iarbháis é toiliú chun orgáin a choinneáil i gcomhair taighde, agus is i marbhlann a tharlaíonn sé
The Irish Donor Network
Líonra Deontóirí na hÉireann (Irish Donor Network)

The Irish Donor Network is a group of individuals and patient associations directly concerned with organ transplantation, donor families and medical co-ordinators involved in organ and tissue transplantation

Is grúpa de dhaoine aonair agus cumainn othar atá bainteach go díreach le trasphlandú orgáin, teaghlaigh bhronntóirí agus comhordaitheoirí leighis a bhaineann le trasphlandú orgáin agus fíocháin atá i Líonra Deontóirí na hÉireann
Those involved in the Network are:
Seo a leanas na daoine atá bainteach leis an líonra seo:
• The Irish Kidney Association
• Cumann Duán na hÉireann
• The Irish Heart and Lung Transplant Association
• Cumann na hÉireann um Thrasphlandú Croí agus Scámhóga (The Irish Heart and Lung Transplant Association)
• The Cystic Fibrosis Association
• Cumann Fiobróise Cistí na hÉireann (The Cystic Fibrosis Association)
• The Irish Lung Fibrosis Association
• Cumann Fiobróise Scámhóga na hÉireann (The Irish Lung Fibrosis Association)
• Alpha One (Anti Trypsin) Foundation
• Fondúireacht Alpha One (Anti Trypsin)
• Liver Transplant Unit in St.Vincent's Hospital
• Aonad Trasphlandaithe Ae in Ospidéal Naomh Uinseann (Liver Transplant Unit in St.Vincent's Hospital)
• The Eye and Bone Banks
• Banc Súl na hÉireann
The Irish Eye Bank no longer accepts ocular donations
Sa bhliain 2004, tháinig stop le deonú súl ag Clárlann Bhanc na Súl
(This is due to the theoretical risk that nvCJD could be transmitted in transplanted corneas.) All corneas and sclera are now imported from the United States of America

(Tharla sé seo mar thoradh ar an mbaol teoiriciúil go bhféadfaí nvCJD a tharchur i gcoirní trasphlandaithe.) Ó shin i leith, is ó Stáit Aontaithe Mheiriceá a n-iomportáiltear gach coirne agus scléara go hÉirinn
The Irish Donor Network promotes, prints and distributes the Gift of Life Donor Card
Cuireann Líonra Deontóirí na hÉireann an Cárta Deontóra Gift of Life chun cinn, priontálann siad é agus scaipeann siad é
By carrying the card and informing your family, you indicate your intention of donating organs and tissue for the purpose of transplantation in the event of your death
Má iompraíonn tú an cárta agus má chuireann tú do theaghlach ar an eolas, cuireann tú in iúl go bhfuil sé de mhian agat orgáin agus fíocháin a bhronnadh chun cuspóirí trasphlandaithe i gcás do bháis
Whole body donation for medical research
Bronnadh coirp iomlán le haghaidh taighde leighis
Medical research is a vital way in which the health profession can learn more about anatomy, research and treating illness
Is bealach ríthábhachtach é taighde leighis trínar féidir leis an ngairm leighis tuilleadh a fhoghlaim faoi anatamaíocht, taighde agus cóireáil leighis
If you want to donate your body for medical research, you should contact one of the 5 medical research schools located in the colleges listed below
Más mian leat do chorp a bhronnadh le haghaidh taighde leighis, ba chóir duit dul i dteagmháil le ceann den 5 scoil taighde leighis atá lonnaithe sna coláistí atá liostaithe thíos
Each medical school has its own procedures for entering into an agreement with you
Tá a nósanna imeachta féin ag gach scoil leighis chun comhaontú a dhéanamh leat
• The Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland
• Coláiste Ríoga na Máinlia i mBaile Átha Cliath
• National University of Ireland, Galway
• Ollscoil na hÉireann, Gaillimh
You should also make sure that your next-of-kin are aware of your wishes
Ba chóir duit a bheith cinnte freisin go bhfuil do neasghaol ar an eolas faoi do mhianta
You can do this by telling them and/or stating that you wish to donate your body for medical research in your will
Is féidir leat é seo a dhéanamh trí insint dóibh agus/nó a chur in iúl gur mian leat do chorp a bhronnadh i gcomhair taighde leighis i d’uacht
The law is unclear on this but it would seem that your next-of-kin, or whoever is responsible for the cremation or interment of your body, are not necessarily obliged to go along with your wishes
Níl an dlí soiléir ina leith seo, ach is cosúil nach gá dod’ neasghaol, nó cibé atá freagrach as créamadh nó cur do choirp, cloí le do mhianta

You can contact any member of the Irish Donor Network for further information or for organ donor cards. You can apply for an Organ Donor Card online or download the smartphone app for the Organ Donor Ecard
Is féidir leat dul i dteagmháil le ball ar bith de Líonra Deontóirí na hÉireann chun tuilleadh eolais a fháil nó chun cárta deontóra orgáin a fháil
Free text the word 'Donor' to 50050 or Lo-call 1890 543 639
Seol ríomhphost chuig donor@ika.ie, seol téacstheachtaireacht in aisce leis an bhfocal ‘Donor’ chuig 50050 nó cuir glaoch Íosghlao ar Donor House ag 1890 543 639
